This game is not for everyone, if you get tilted or angered easily you will not have fun playing this. If you can't talk the fall for your own mistakes this game isn't for you.
The game is still pretty unbalanced, but that can be excused in my mind due to the immense difficulty in balancing a 4v1 style of game.
Playing survivor alone can be frustrating for anyone because survivors can be absolutely garbage yet still reach high ranks by teaming up with better players and due to the fact that de-ranking is hard to do naturally.
On the other hand playing with two-three friends is a absolute blast, whether you are trying as hard as possible to win with the advantage that actual communication gives you, or are just messing around with four dwights all dressed as pizza boys.
On the killer side of the darkness however, there are a massive array of playstyles to try out, from flinging one-hit axes across the corn rows, to running around like usain bolt with a chainsaw chopping survivors in half, to stalking the unaware survivors from a distance until the perfect moment to scare the absolute crap out of them. With the combinations of two addons and four perks a killer with the same power can feel like a completely character. Unfortunately because there is four survivors and one of you not all killers can get the job done against a competent team, while some killers give absolutely no counter play to them when used correctly.
While bugs are a problem in this game I often find them more amusing than annoying, like a killers arm getting formed into a flexing position after dropping a survivor off his back.
In the end the TL;DR is this game is better with friends and not for the easily angered.
